availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. N. McCaslin (Caldwell co, ky, carpenter, pvt usa)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James McCaslin and Mary McCaslin. Married to Nancy McCaslin. Father of Mary J. McCaslin, Harriett S. McCaslin, S. Belle McCaslin, P. A. McCaslin, and J. A. McCaslin. Laborer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Carpenter in St. Clair County, Illinois, in 1860. Served in the 48th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from October 26, 1863, to December 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 286A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, St. Clair County, Township 1, Range 8, 559.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 480A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 479.
